title: Textile, 1850–1900
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 73 x 29.5 cm (28 3/4 x 11 5/8 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 73 x 42 cm (28 3/4 x 16 9/16 in.)
Warp x Weft (c): 55.5 x 41 cm (21 7/8 x 16 1/8 in.)
Repeat H: 44 cm (17 5/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment
description: Offset repeat of a twisting branch supporting various flowers including tulip, ferns and small scale plants attached to branch. Purple monochrome pattern. Length of repeat: 44cm. (17 1/4"). Width of fabric possibly 33" with 1 1/2" excess pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1850–1900.
1850–1900. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment. 1976-10-14-a/c.
